title: Country Salad
summary: Country Salad might be just the side dish you are searching for. One portion of this dish contains roughly 6g of protein, 34g of fat, and a total of 426 calories. For $1.64 per serving, this recipe covers 12% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. This recipe serves 4. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes roughly 30 minutes. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. A mixture of pear, roquefort, lemon juice, and a handful of other ingredients are all it takes to make this recipe so delicious. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free and primal diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 54%. This score is solid. Try Country salad, Country Potato Salad, and Country Rice Salad for similar recipes.
instructions: Instructions                                                                                                                                                                                                                 Tear the chicory into bite-size pieces. Place in a large salad bowl, cover with paper toweling, and refrigerate.                                                    Peel the pear and cut into -inch cubes. Place the cubes in a small bowl and toss with the lemon juice. Set aside.                                                    In a small skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until crisp and golden, about 5 minutes. Drain the bacon on paper toweling. Discard the bacon fat and wipe off the skillet. Add the walnuts to the skillet and toast over low heat, stirring often, just until they begin to give off their oil, about 2 minutes. Remove from the heat and set aside.                                                    Prepare the dressing: In a small bowl, whisk the salt, vinegar, and mustard with the pepper. Gradually add the oil and whisk until emulsified. Set aside.                                                    Pour the dressing over the chicory and toss to coat. Divide the salad among 4 plates and sprinkle with the bacon, pear, walnuts, and Roquefort cheese.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                var articleType_27_data = {};                    articleType_27_data.init_step_by_step_images = 0;

steps.step: Tear the chicory into bite-size pieces.
Place in a large salad bowl, cover with paper toweling, and refrigerate.
Peel the pear and cut into -inch cubes.
Place the cubes in a small bowl and toss with the lemon juice. Set aside.
In a small skillet over medium heat, cook the bacon until crisp and golden, about 5 minutes.
Drain the bacon on paper toweling. Discard the bacon fat and wipe off the skillet.
Add the walnuts to the skillet and toast over low heat, stirring often, just until they begin to give off their oil, about 2 minutes.
Remove from the heat and set aside.
Prepare the dressing: In a small bowl, whisk the salt, vinegar, and mustard with the pepper. Gradually add the oil and whisk until emulsified. Set aside.
Pour the dressing over the chicory and toss to coat. Divide the salad among 4 plates and sprinkle with the bacon, pear, walnuts, and Roquefort cheese.
